items.title: U.S. stock futures inch higher as investors digest ongoing tech selloff
items.summary: U.S. stock futures were little changed late Monday, following another brutal week for tech stocks.

items.title: ‘Am I crazy?’ My boyfriend’s parents say he doesn’t earn enough to marry me. Who is to blame here?
items.summary: The Moneyist: “I have a Valentine’s message for you, but you won’t read it in a Hallmark card.”

items.title: ‘It’s a life-changing sum’: Can I stop my kids from using their inheritance to support political causes I vehemently oppose?
items.summary: ”I would hate for our money to end up in the hands of organizations that oppose everything we have supported throughout our lives.”

items.title: ‘I’m a loner’: I’m 62 with a multimillion-dollar portfolio and no heirs. Should I find a wife for my twilight years?
items.summary: “I have never been married, have no siblings, and both my parents have passed away.”

items.title: ‘I feel the clock ticking’: My wife and I are in our 60s — and employ 48 people in a small town. Can we ever retire?
items.summary: “We could survive financially, but my people would not.”

items.title: Shipping industry set to consolidate as Hapag-Lloyd to buy Israeli firm for 58% premium
items.summary: Shipping giant Hapag-Lloyd agreed to buy Israel’s ZIM Integrated Shipping Services for $4.2 billion.

items.title: These might be the winners from the latest round of Chinese new year AI launches
items.summary: The holiday period is crucial for the launch of new products and Chinese AI plays are trying to prove they are as good as, or close enough to, global frontier models from OpenAI and Google.

items.title: Hegseth reportedly considering severe penalty on Anthropic as negotiations stall
